TopicTitle: Is it possible to make a mod that semi-randomly spawns in hostile attack aircraft for a "Nation like feel"?

Articles.Content:
Hear me out, lets say If you start to fly over a certain area on the globe, you'll get a screen message saying, "You have entered - Territory", and if you don't leave in 120 seconds or so, 1-3 attack aircraft are spawned using vessel mover somehow, and intercept and form up on you before the two minutes are over. The aircraft would likely be already pre designed for vanilla and the mods dependencies, which would be BDA, Vessel Mover, and Physics Range Extender at least. The aircraft can be a number of roles based on what your current craft type is, such as if you're a lander type it'll spawn an A-10, SU-25, or some type of ground strike vehicle, where as if you're a plane it'll spawn a fighter, so on so forth. If you enter a region and shoot down an aircraft, public relations will drop like 10% with that Nation, If its under 50% you're at war, and have to place defenses in order to protect the KSC, or wherever you're launching from. Please help me make this happen, I've wanted to do this for so long and now that KSP has had its final update, I think it'd be plausible for years of fun. I would code it myself but I'm horrible so there's that lol

(Possibly make your own dif nations attack craft? idk, it would be cool to fight a design that isn't mine that I haven't looked for and downloaded, much love)
I do not know, but the place to ask would be the modding subforum, and so your question has been moved there.

This is really interesting actually there maybe a mod out there but I have no clue pretty much about that. But if you want this to be a mod we have to create countries and program the said countries. But in the long run it can be worth it. But I have no modding experience so I can't really help about that.

Contract Configurator has support for BDArmory and can spawn crafts. There is some example contract code about a raid on the Island Airfield in this fork of GAP:  https://github.com/7ranceaddic7/GAP 

Not sure how complete it is , but someone thought is was possible.
